attributes.action: MPS should take a temporary 20% pay cut to support NHS and frontline workers
attributes.additional_details: Many health care workers are working without adequate PPE due to underfunding of the NHS making them ill-equipped to handle the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond showing appreciation by clapping, government officials should take proper initiative and demonstrate integrity by taking a paycut to demonstrate support and solidarity for frontline workers who are working tirelessly to save lives, the PM’s life being one of them.
attributes.background: MPs to take a 20% paycut for the duration of the COVID-19 pandemic. In light of the current healthcare crisis, members of parliament should take a pay cut, much like UK citizens all over the country, in order to help the heroes on the front lines.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
